biology
  specialized an evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) with flat leaves made up of many small parts, and small cones (= fruits). There are several types of thuja: Many conifers, particularly junipers and thuja, cope well with drought. The thujas we planted in early summer haven't grown much in the hot weather.
More examplesFewer examplesGolden thuja looks good in a container.The area is dotted with oak, chestnut, pine, and thuja trees, and is enormously attractive.Thujas include the upright green Fastigiata, Cuprea with its coppery foliage, and the dense, slow growing Hillieri.
